page.title: 04St.Lawrence Village
page.content: St.Lawrence is situated between a great rocky cliff on the north and the sea to the south.The village and surrounding area is very{ picturesque.The tiny village was built chiefly in Queen Victoria's reign around the old church which dates from the 12th century.It was at first so small that it hardly merited the title of'village'. The area is extremely popular today particularly with older people because of its peacefulness and remarkable scenery.People come to retire here and the great wall of the 'Undercliff' now shelters many large and distinctive villas which fall into a higher than average price range on the market. There is one provision shop which incorporates a Post Office serving the community, a parish church and a village hall.
